summary: Alger Wilson stood in front of a window, considering the report he had to produce when he arrived at Pasu Island. It was at that moment when the endless gray fog and a figure lording over him appeared. Alger then saw a dark red glow and saw a blurry figure resembling The World. He then heard the figure's calm words. He found it difficult to suppress his joy as a strong sense of bewilderment and shock emerged within his heart. He remembered very clearly that The World had only promised The Sun to obtain the Notary potion formula within three days at the last Tarot Club gathering. He hadn't mentioned anything related to the Ocean Songster potion formula, but in just days, this gentleman had obtained the rare Sequence 5 formula and even its main ingredient!What did he do exactly? Alger muttered silently to himself as he couldn't help but recall Gehrman Sparrow's cold and formidable appearance. The man was more and more unfathomable. Alger fell into deep thought, depressed to realize that he didn't have any items or money of equal value. He quickly calmed his heart as he focused on another matter. He tried a divination on Groselle's Travels which he had brought above the gray fog. To his surprise, the divination ended in a failure. The book didn't appear special in any way, appearing so ordinary that only history fans would notice it. Klein knew very well that the Spectator pathway's Sequence 0 had long Klein's eyes spewed out with blood as his ears were left with two black holes. His mouth and nostrils had white matter stained with blood spew out from them. The scene quickly zoomed in as a palace with a height of over two hundred meters occupied Klein's vision. The space was so large that it allowed any dragon to move freely within. The "camera" kept moving inward, and soon, Klein saw a book made of yellowish-brown goatskin. Its cover was blank as it floated in midair. Compared to its surroundings, it was amazingly small. It was written by an ancient god, a storybook that can automatically deduce the ending. When this book was formed, the Dragon of Imagination likely hadn't encountered the ancient sun god and was fine. It just begs the question if the ancient gods are stronger than the real gods of the present day. After some consideration, he thought of finding a chance to enter the book in search for clues. Once I encounter any trouble, I'll immediately return. I have to be careful and cautious...Klein nodded as he divined that leaving Groselle's Travels above the gray fog would bring undesirable changes to the mysterious space, but was not sure if he actually knew why this was a place that transcended the spirit world. After deciding to take a look, Klein threw the junk pile into the pile so as to prevent any accidents, he took off. Klein handed over the elf queen's golden wine cup to Edwina. She habitually studied the engravings and symbols on the cup before withdrawing her gaze in embarrassment. She then looked out the window and said, "They'll be organizing a bonfire party. Will you be participating?" Klein shook his head. "I don't plan on participating either. Not everyone is like Anderson, who can quickly raise his spirits," she said with pursed lips. "Actually, it's not necessarily a bad thing...Klein was momentarily at a loss for a response. And apart from "giving lessons," Edwine wasn't good at socializing" "Are you selling that key that originates from the giants?" Klein silently inhaled and broke the silence. "Yes." She added, "I can lend it to you for studying. You can decide whether to buy it before leaving the ship." "Put this in Siatas's tomb." "I'm sorry, I don't know what to do with it," Klein said. "It's in the captain's cabin. I'm not allowed to take it with me." "You can take it if you want." "No, I'm sorry. I can't take it." "What do you want with it?" Klein asked. "Put it in Sia's tomb" "I'll take it when I get back to the ship" "Yes, I will," she replied.

After a brief moment of stupefaction, Emlyn couldn't help but look around. He suspected that The World was lurking around him, as though he was one of the nearby believers. Emlyn was left in utter shock as he stood up and walked to the clergymen's break room at the back. In a quiet and empty environment, he replied, "Honorable Mr. Fool, I wish to directly communicate with The World." In less than ten seconds, he saw a dark red glow surge forward like a tidal wave and devour him. He found himself inside the majestic palace and was seated at his seat. At the other end of the mottled table was the blurry-figure of The World who was waiting for him. The World said with a hoarse laugh, "We might have met before." He didn't speak further and only mentioned the key point. As for whether Emlyn could figure out the situation, that wasn't his problem. He said, "The rental fee will cost 300 pounds, as well as five pages of Beyonder powers in Leymano's Travels." He decided to outsource half of the debt he had to Emlyn. After closing the real deal, he immediately returned to the world and walked into the Harvest Church's breakroom for the clergyman's break for the Sunday service. He immediately fell into a dilemma. He had never tried borrowing similar items from the bishop. If it wasn't because Emlyn had been Bishop Utravsky gave Emlyn the Mental Terror Candle. Emlyn was stunned, finding it unbelievable that the bishop would agree so easily. He didn't immediately accept it as he couldn't help but ask, "Aren't you afraid that I'll lose the candle?" The bishop replied, "Everyone and every item has its end. They will all return to the earth, buried deep within the soil and sprout, grow, and bloom, one incarnation after another" Emlyn didn't delay, for he didn't wish to give his alternate personality a chance to grow. He wanted to resolve the problem completely while it was still weak; otherwise, what awaited him was the irreversible fate of losing control. He used the excuse of needing to treat his friend to leave the Harvest Church. He randomly found an inn and set up the sacrificial ritual. The mysterious space above the gray fog would completely screen the negative effects of the combat between the two personalities. The candle's wick was very short and was entirely black in color. It was covered in thin densely packed scale-like patterns. The surface was covered with what looked like human skin. There were a few warts that protruded out. He was another "Klein" with black hair, brown eyes, thin built, average-looking features, a rather deep outline, and a scholarly air to him. He appeared to have grown in strength, and he wasn't able to use the objects in the external world. Klein remained silent as he raised his Sea God Scepter-wielding right hand. Zhou Mingrui made the blue gems on the tip of the scepter light up one after another. "Klein" was already awash with tears as he yelled angrily and fearfully, "I only wanted to remind you!"Amidst shrill cries, the figure rapidly dissipated as a bolt of lightning wiped all traces of it. Then, he ultimately maintained his lucidity as he left the mind world. "I've already come to know who I am. If I were to let you go, it would be equivalent to splitting the two up, admitting that they are opposing parties. That way, I'll immediately lose control once I return to the real world...Klein lowered the scpter and closed his eyes as he sighed silently. "Let me go. Let me go... I have no ill intentions!" he said. "If I wasn't trying to reminding you, why would I have exposed myself!?" he added. "It would be like admitting that you are an opposing party!" he exclaimed. "That's what I'm trying to do!" he replied. "You're not the only one who has fused with Klein's memories and emotions. You're the one who's fused with my emotions and memories, too!" "I don't want to split you up. I want to keep you together!"

Amon's projection subconsciously turned its head and looked in the direction of the palm. It saw the pus-covered, one-eyed giant who had long since died. The curse of the grayish-yellow fog kept emanating from "His" body. But it was different from before. There were seemingly illusory black tubes behind "He" back. They extended all the way into the infinite distance, a mystery as to what they were connected to. The "Twilight Sword" tore through the void and jumped out from the spot where the Angel of Time, Amon, was standing. It ripped through everything around it, turning into a storm that could destroy this desolate moor. But no matter how the orange-red "sword" storm raged, it didn't harm "Him" at all. The Evernight Goddess had come to a certain level of influence in the Land of the Gods, other than the True Creator. She could use the Uniqueness of the Death Goddess to exert a low degree of influence on some things in the Forsaken Land. The former Chief of the City of Silver was very likely related to Artificial Death. This explained something-that for some unknown reason, those that could influence the Forsaken Gods could be more powerful than the Creator. And now, Klein considered the Evernight in some ways!Based on this reasoning, Klein suspected that the Goddess could use this power to help him in his most desperate hour. Klein wasn't one of Amon's "Parasites" either. Amon wasn't aware of the former City of Silver Chief's abnormality involving the black illusory tubes. Klein had no idea what the final outcome would be. He had mostly focused his attention on the fact that Amon's avatar had been replaced by "His" true body. After completing this attack, Klein, who was high above the gray fog, immediately cut off the connection between Sefirah Castle and the real world. He then saw himself-glazed eyes, on the brink of losing control. He saw Amon's projection which had circled around the bluish-black palm using an "error." He had finally succeeded in committing suicide. The entire gray fog boiled as the entirety of Sefire Castle quaked. A vast amount of terrifying power gathered over, transforming into a torrent of lightning. The blue gems that lit up at the same time sent an illuminating light that surged down like a torrent, drowning Amon's avatars and his own body. The black tubes didn't persist, and they instead shrank back into the depths of the darkness. Dressed in the classic black robe, Amon stood in a classic hat and pointed hat and said, "I am the God of Combat, and I am here to kill you all." The black giant immediately began to rot, quickly being reduced to bones and reduced to a point that kept Bladel "existing" "He" raised "His" head and looked into the sky silently for a few seconds, as though he was looking at Sefirah Castle through the fog of history. He discovered that the Beyonder characteristics that had been destroyed with his body had unknowingly entered the Historical Void. It fused with the Worms of Spirit from the past, turning them corporeal. The miracle of "resurrection" was essentially a deeper use of one's strength from the future. The number of resurrections I'm using now is depleting the number I'll have after I become a Miracle Invoker... From the looks of it, there's only one chance now. Tsk... Amon should be guarding my "corpse" now. If it really doesn't work, I'll just abandon my body and become an undead! Klein's mind raced. The whole story's origins was when I was reading the Cthulhu myth. When I saw the line about the stars being right, I suddenly thought of this: We often say that Cthulhu will awaken soon, but what happens if Cthulhu has already awakened...? For those who don't know much about Cthulhu, it doesn't matter. Just treat this name as an evil god. After all, the corresponding deities were completely reconstructed by me. He's a very patient God of Mischief... Yes, my current state can only be maintained for three days. After that period of time, I won't be able to borrow powers from the Past to resurrect

After hearing Macht's reply, and combining what he knew, Klein guessed that the rat in the manor was likely the Marauder demigod which had been by Hazel's side. As for why it went rabid and bit Hazel, he was unsure. He nodded slightly and tapped his chest four times in a clockwise fashion. "May the Goddess bless her."After saying that, he walked past the host, entered the hall, and waited for the ball tonight to begin. The scene from before surfaces in the girl's mind as her blurry dream-like state gradually turned clear. She saw gray rats crawling out from the corner of her bedroom, balcony, and bed. All of them had dark red eyes but could only produce squeaking sounds. The more she looked, the more terrified she became. She had no idea what she would discover next, nor did she understand what the person was who created the dream to begin with. The only thing she was certain of was that the other party's level and strength in the supernatural domain far exceeded hers! This shattered what little pride she had left after she had been thrown into an illusion for nearly ten seconds. It was as though it wasn't her hand that was bitten but her heart. She was in a similar state, her entire being turbid and muddled. Her left hand was wrapped in thick bandages, but there weren't any more signs of blood. Her expression was heavy, nothing like her usual arrogance. Hazel was afraid to head to the manor and inform her teacher, but she was afraid of encountering danger and end up being sacrificed. Her teacher had seemingly lost the ability to communicate. To go from North Borough's Böklund Street to Macht's manor in Backlund's northwestern suburbs would take three to five hours on carriage. Klein had used Tinder before and had some idea about the powers of the Marauder pathway. He suspected that Hazel, who had an item of a higher level, could "steal" the flight abilities of birds and use that short period of time to cross the river. This way, she might arrive within three hours.Regardless, I'll be faster than her... Klein retracted his gaze and began considering who his next dance partner should be. "I'm a little tired. I plan on sleeping now. Don't let anyone disturb me," Hazel said to her lady's maid outside. "Yes, my lady," the maid immediately replied. "You're not a likable girl, she has quite a kind heart... Klein nodded indiscernibly and praised her inwardly. He had already noticed Hazel's actions thanks to his intuition. He wasn't worried about her actions, because to go from BöKlund Street. to Machsmanor in the northwestern suburbs of Backlund. It was inevitable to spend five hours traveling. At night, there were only three bridges to consider, and they were all under the Tussock Red-eyed rats ran out from the roof beams, storage cabinets, and all kinds of miscellaneous. Klein could control as many as 50 marionettes, a number that would rise once he finished digesting the potion. The rats reflected into his eyes as Klein pulled the human-skinned glove on his left hand, casting his gaze towards the flowerbed in the manor. He was none other than Gehrman Sparrow, the Bizarro Sorcerer's marionette. He left the ball ahead of time, returned to Dwayne Dantès's residence and entered his bedroom. Then, he teleported over with Winner Enuni and the latter had been left outside theManor to allow for any instantaneous switches in positions. The result was that the two men were able to take control of a large number of rats at once. They had to fight their way through the rats to get to the other side of the house, which was guarded by a large group of maids. They were eventually able to defeat the rats, but they had to wait until the next day to find out what had happened to the man who had won the ball the night before. The man was later revealed to be a former member of the Royal Family, who had died in a car crash in the early hours of the morning. He had been killed by a rat that had been bitten by Miss Hazel, one of the maids who had been at the ball.

West Borough, Grimm Garden Street                Klein, with a quite a stubble around his mouth, wore a pair of gold-rimmed glasses while carrying a top hat and a black cane. He followed Rogo Colloman into a spacious and bright living room. There was a huge crystal chandelier hanging from the ceiling. The walls, corners, and tables were decorated with all kinds of golden carvings and ornaments. The entire area looked gorgeous, exquisite, and luxurious. However, the boy was wrapped in a thick fur coat and had a blanket that looked burning hot on his legs. At that moment, he had his head low, tightly hugging himself as he shivered nonstop. His dark blue hair seemed to have lost its luster. The color of Adol's aura had been dyed with a deep blackish-green sheen! This is a sign of being haunted by wraiths. Or perhaps, there were no such things as "bad company" at all...Klein quietly reached out, held Mr. Azik's copper whistle, and allowed his spirituality to spread. Then, he thoughtfully looked away from Adol and looked at the others inside theliving room. By the oriel window stood a man in a black coat. He was tall and sturdy, not smiling, and his waist was bulging as if he were hiding a gun. This should be one of the six bodyguards... Klein was about to size up another Klein and Stuart, a young man with a full beard, went to their rooms on the second floor. After dinner, you guys have some rest and take over your shifts in the early morning," Kaslana added. Adol sat in the rocking chair, holding onto Azik's copper whistle, quietly watching his ward. The two of them had arrived at their destination and entered their respective rooms. The sound of a gunshot rang out, and without thinking, Stuart rolled over, while KasLana and Lydia quickly got off the sofa, each finding a place to hide. The only thing left in his coat was herbal powder, extract essence, keys, and his wallet. There were a total of 206 pounds in paper bills in his wallet, and he was carrying a black cane. He had already transferred the paper figurines, notes, charms, a matchbox, etc to his trouser pockets. He was about the same age as Lydia, and almost as tall as Klein, a little over 1.7m and weighing 140lb. Stuart had an armpit holster, and in it, there was obviously a specially designed revolver. He patted his clothes with great interest, got up and asked, "Why haven't I heard of you, Mr. Moriarty? I mean, I know a lot of people in the detective business, but I've not heard about you in the past." "I only came to Backlund in early September," Klein briefly explained Stuart sipped his coffee at his desk while waiting for Adol to wake up. As time passed, a cold chill swept through the room. Adol's face seemed paler, and his lips were turning purple. Stuart was about to speak when he saw Sherlock Moriarty stand up and nod at him. "I'll follow him." Stuart let out a sigh of relief and followed him to the entrance of the washroom two rooms away. He saw a young man standing a few steps away. The man was wearing a white shirt, dark trousers, and a pair of gold-rimmed glasses. He was leaning against the wall with a smile on his face. The figure in the mirror was so pale that it looked like a corpse. He turned around and glared at Klein's left hand, at the delicate copper whistle that was being tossed up and down. He continued smiling and snapped his fingers. With a loud bang, a flame rose from the ground, igniting an invisible figure. It struggled for a few moments before completely dispersing. The flames extinguished as a result, and the figure was no longer visible to the public. "What happened to you?" Stuart asked Adol in a soft, dreamy voice. "It's been a long nightmare for me," Adol replied. "And I'm not going to let you out of my sight. Heh, do whatever you have to do, and pretend that I don't exist."

10 o'clock at night, in the alley by the back door of the Bravehearts Bar. Klein, in his black double-breasted frock  coat and matching half top hat, had merely circled the bar once before  he walked to the nearest street as though he were on a stroll. As he walked out of the alley, a carriage stopped in front of him. Behind the glass window was Maric's pair of brown eyes which were  still suppressing any signs of malicious intent. He sat down and straightened his bow tie like a gentleman attending a banquet. He handed the three sedatives to Maric. Maric looked at the sealed and transparent glass test tube, gently  shaking the liquid inside and said, "Two and a half. Any more and I will  really be sedated. I wouldn't do anything for a short period of time." Klein praised and turned to look at Sharron. "Have you guys decided on the ambush spot?"Sharron nodded. "We're on the way there."She didn't directly reveal the intended location to Klein. He pondered for a moment, and he asked again after some deliberation, "Do you feel the power of purification and exorcism now?" "No," Maric replied hoarsely. "Very good," Klein replied. "The Sun Brooch, is indeed able to isolate the effects of this spirituality cage from a wall of spirituality." Klein asked, "Do they have any other mystical  items or Beyonder weapons besides the Scarlet Lunar Corona?" Maric pinched his glabella, looking a bit irritated. "Even if they have mystical items, they would lack the reason to use them." "Unless it's something passive," added Maric. "But to a Werewolf,  their claws are their Beyonder weapon. It's the same for me, Tyre, and Jason. It can tear through steel and comes with venom." "Alright, I have no more questions," said Klein. "We'll go and lure the enemy over. Please make use of the time you have to make your move" "The simpler the plan, the more effective it is," Sharron calmly responded. "Steve isn't a fool. If any problem arises in a complicated plan, it will lead to a disaster" "I'm so hot," said the zombie driver. "I've got to get out of here." "Yes, you do," replied the zombie. "It's time to go." "I'll be in touch with you in a few minutes," said Sharron. "Make sure to be patient. Don't be in a hurry to makeyour move." "No, I won't," replied Klein, "I just want to make sure you don't get hurt." "Good," replied Sharron, "Because if you do, I'll kill you." Klein dug a shallow hole in the middle of the open ground and buried the small square iron box in his hand. The paper figurine he had left between the two warehouses stood up and transformed into a gentleman wearing a black double-breasted frock coat, a silk half top hat, and was holding a hard cane. The gentleman's position was rather remote and hidden, making it  difficult for anyone who came in from the outside to notice him. The enemy was a Sequence 5 wielding a mystical item! There was also a Sequence 6 and Sequence 7! Is this the state every magician is in before he goes onstage? Klein took a silent breath, suppressing his emotions and the heat of his body. His vision wasn't affected in any way, and he could clearly see the road that led to the clearing. The crimson moon was constantly obscured by the clouds, and there was only a glimmer of light in the clearing, but Klein saw three figures rapidly approaching. They required a special sealing environment that was specially designed  for it. The ground is muddy from the rain earlier...Klein took out a piece of paper and shook it. He removed the spirituality cage on its surface and  took out the dark golden sunbird shaped brooch, solemnly wearing it on  his left chest. He buried the remaining explosive sticks near the center. He counted and confirmed the various charms,  extract, and herbal powders. He touched the iron cigarette case and  snapped his

Alger Wilson's Blue Avenger was following the borders of the Sonia Island back to the Loen coast. He saw a large sail through the fog in the distance, and a massive ship silently cruised past. Behind it were several similar ships that formed a fleet that spanned a great distance. Alger stared at this scene for a moment before speaking in a serious tone. "Is war about to erupt...?" he asked. "Yes, I think it is," the ship's captain replied. "It's going to be a long time before it ends." "Yes," he replied, "It will be a very long time." "I believe it will be," he said, "but I don't know for how long." "It won't be long at all," he added, "because it's already too late" "I think it will end in a few days," said the captain. "I'm sure of it." "No, it won't," he agreed. "Because it's too late". "I don't believe it, but I'm sure it will." "What do you mean?" "I mean, what do you think it means?" "It means that the Feysac Empire is mobilizing its naval fleet in the Sonia Sea." "Where are they heading to?" "Sonia Island," said Alger. "That's where they're going." "And where are they going?" "To Sonia Island," replied Alger. Melissa Moretti was a 16-year-old student at Backlund University of Technology. She had to go to Chancellor Moment's office today to prepare for the upcoming mechanical laboratory that was to be officially launched. She felt that life on campus was so wonderful and that her classmates were so adorable. Suddenly, a metallic gray object descended from the sky and landed in the middle of the square. The steam locomotive's head was already in pieces, its components and fragments were scattered everywhere. The students around it, and those passing by, had already collapsed to the ground, their bodies no longer intact. They were no longer breathing. Some of them were covered in blood, others charred. There were some moaning in pain. The scene was like an oil painting that wasn't realistic enough. Melissa stared at it in a daze, momentarily at a loss for a reaction. She was only 16 years old after all-she had never experienced such a scene before. She fled in panic, not knowing what had happened. The teachers rushed to rescue the injured and evacuate the students that had been caught in the blast. It was only when many rushed out of the block and started to rescue them that Melissa woke up from her trance and moved closer to the teachers. They hurriedly split up into two groups, one to head to Tiffany Cathedral and the other to hide in an underground area that you can hide in. One of the teachers wore a look of terror, but he still held his There's no danger here. There's an underground area that you can hide in. The subway probably hadn't stopped moving. The kingdom's parliament, various departments, and municipal halls are there. At this moment, a bomb was blown over by a hurricane and was landing towards the area. But suddenly, the bomb changed directions abruptly and flew off horizontally. It exploded in midair, only stirring up a blast of air. Many buildings had collapsed as they were burning in scarlet flames. Broken limbs, blood, and the dead were everywhere. She could hear cries, screams, and orders. She tried to run towards the four-story building where the kingdom's Ministry of Finance was located. However, the area had already been sealed. The walls were riddled with bullet holes, and there were still traces of an explosion. She saw a familiar figure. It was the black-haired, brown-eyed Benson who wasn't wearing a hat. He looked anxious and angry as he shouted, "Why are you here? Why aren't you hiding underground! I'm very safe here!" Melissa, who had never been shouted at by her brother, wanted to instinctively retort, but her vision was already blurry. "It's good that you're okay. Quick, don't wander around on the streets."Upon hearing his words, the panic and concern in Melissa's heart calmed down. She felt that even if she were to die, it wouldn't be that scary anymore. At

100 Böklund Street, in a corner of the garden in Portland Moment's residence. Many ladies and gentlemen had bid farewell. Hazel's mother, Ma'am Riana, saw her father, Member of Parliament Macht, and a few other gentlemen walking down as they conversed with lively expressions. Dwayne Dantès said that he encountered ghosts when he was in the Southern Continent. He and his companions suddenly woke up in the middle of the night and found themselves unable to open their eyes. Their bodies were heavy, as though someone was pressing on them. They frantically left the town after the sun rose. The stories he told were sourced from one of Anderson's experiences. He didn't want Trissy to be in the vicinity any longer, wishing that she could recover and take action. He had already decided to send the iron cigarette down the sewers to check the area to confirm that Trissy's condition was fine. He also didn't wish to cause any trouble as his identity as Senor Dwayne Klein was still a secret. He made the marionette appear within the full-body case and opened the case to confirm his identity. Trissy appeared in the case and said, "I am Trissy, the Demoness of the Sun. I need items or charms in the Sun domain... I need to find out if you are still alive or not." Trissy then disappeared into the darkness. Klein made the marionette in the ancient triangular hat leap onto the street lamp's surface before passing through the manhole cover in a Wraith form. He quickly approached the hidden fork where Trissy hid herself at. Trissy had her luscious black hair cascading down, unlike peers her age who had different hairstyles. She looked like a dreamy flower that was silently blooming in the night. Klein made Senor ask, "Why do you say that?" Trissy's gaze swept over the Wraith's face and said, "It's said that Admiral of Blood is someone who indulges in his desires, and he has no resistance towards beautiful females and males" She paused as she slightly narrowed her slender eyes. "I'm afraid of finding myself lost to Pleasure and ending up being controlled by you." This was indeed one of the reasons why she had raised the topic. Klein actively ignored the topic and made the Marionette say, "You're seeking out the target tomorrow? After all, the royal captain knows you like what you look like." Trissy lowered her head and looked at her toes before chuckling at her head. "Rest at ease, I have the perfect plan at ease. It has signs of prolonged human activity. It's set off from here, at the end of the sixth left fork is a hidden passage. If you need to relieve yourself, just go to the washroom." Heh heh, I discovered it while walking around in the past few days. He made Senor smile and say, "Did you discover anything?" Trissy shook her head. "There was nothing at all. Perhaps only a certain pathway, or someone with a specific item, can find the clues." Perhaps a Marauder's intuition, or something on Hazel's person? Klein didn't make Senor continue on the topic as he pressed his hand to his chest and bowed with a smile. "Since you've recovered, I can be at ease." The moment he said that, he suddenly vanished. Trissy focused her eyes into a stare, but it was to no avail. Only when the invisible threads she had released was hit by a breeze did she retract her gaze, confirming that Admiral of Blood had really left the manhole. Fors woke up naturally on a Sunday morning as she got up to wash up. As she chewed on a fresh piece of toast, she retrieved a stack of items from her mailbox. She flipped through the items and discovered a reply letter she had been looking forward to. Fors quickly read through the letter as she muttered in surprise. She saw the toast in her mouth plunge to the ground. The reply letter said, "Teacher is already in Backlund?" Fors quickly tore open the envelope and saw that it was a letter from Hazel. The letter said that Hazel had been sent to Backlund to be Hazel's teacher.

Klein had a certain degree of curiosity towards the outcome of the exploration. He didn't ask further as he walked past the captain's cabin and walked down the stairwell. After a few seconds, he felt his throat itch. He couldn't help but raise his fist to his mouth and cough. He had carried the Biological Poison Bottle for more than two hours last night. Only when it was late at night and his confirmation that Admiral of Stars and crew didn't have any intention of attacking him did he move the mystical item into a black suitcase. Sadly, he ended up falling sick. His body wasn't in a weakened state, so his resulting illness wasn't anything serious. He just felt his tonsils swell in pain. Cattleya, who was walking slowly behind, saw this scene, but she didn't find it a problem. Instead, she found it normal. It was common knowledge for knowledgeable Beyonders that mystical items were bound to have negative side effects. They would learn from the seven orthodox Churches and categorize those with serious side effects which made them impossible to possess or use for prolonged time as Sealed Artifacts. To most Beyonders, the disadvantages surpassed the advantages. She discovered that Gehrman Sparrow had used mystical items, Beyonder weapons, and spirituality charms to arm himself to the teeth. While being amazed, she was already guessing at the type of negative effects he was facing. From what she saw today, it was a temporary simple illness. Nina was taken aback, somewhat at a loss for a response to continue the conversation. She had originally planned on asking Gehrman Sparrow if she was lacking in charm, or ask if he was the cold type. But considering how the man standing before her was a powerful guy, an adventurer who nearly successfully hunted Vice Admiral Ailment, or a lunatic who could draw his gun and shoot at any moment, she rationally held back her jesting words. At this moment, the classical clock hanging in the hall read 7:23. The disguised Klein took out his golden pocket watch, looked at the exact time, then he sealed the room with a wall of spirituality. He quickly set up an altar and conducted a ritual.

The man then left and Xio went back to her room to think about what she had just said. She then wrote the opening to her new book and threw it into the trash can. She was dazed for a long time when she suddenly recalled the tail that had been following her for the past few days. She spent most of her time reading novels, newspapers, and magazines. The man then gave her a new commission to complete. He told her to take note of the people Viscount Stratford interacts with, and list them down in a report before submitting it to him. Xio knew why: He was the captain of the royal guards; he was once her father's deputy. The mission is a rather complicated one, but if she can complete it, she'll have enough points to buy the Interrogator potion formula at other Beyonder gatherings. The man laughed and said with a laughing sigh, "I wish you luck. I already have the Beyonder characteristic! I might be able to purchase the ingredients at other gatherings." "This is mostly normal for a gathering. It's not a special occasion."

Klein walked alone, his thoughts running wild and unbridled. He sometimes considered his plan for revenge, sometimes thinking back to the times he spent with the Captain. He let out a bitter smile and muttered with a self-deprecating tone, "If I went up and knocked on the door, Melissa might faint from shock... Benson would be so nervous his hair would start to drop. He would then try his best to calmly convince me, in the name of a curly-haired baboon..." He realized that he was standing on Daffodil Street. Opposite him was the house he shared with his brother and sister. He didn't have any other belongings on him except for the clothes he was wearing, his topaz pendulum, and Azik's copper whistle. But, as someone who was "dead," hedidn't have pounds, nor soli, nor pennies. He decided to make do by finding a place to sleep for the time being and head to the Tingen branch Klein spent 38 pounds on two sets of formal wear, two shirts, two trousers, two pairs of leather boots, two bow ties, four pairs of socks, as well as two thick double-breasted jackets. He also bought a cane, a wallet, and a leather luggage bag. He rented a private carriage directly to the train station in Tingen in order to avoid meeting anyone familiar. He then hid in a shady area on the opposite side and looked at the door to his house. There were many times when he felt like heading over, but he couldn't bring himself to cross the wide street. He was happy that the Loen Kingdom didn't have a strict census. He could prove his identity just by using the water and gas bills, asWell as his rent for the past three months. Purchasing a train ticket was even easier, as all he needed was money. He had an empty feeling in his heart as he was about to leave for Backlund from Tingen. He wanted to see his siblings again. He suddenly realized why he hadn't picked an earlier train but instead bought a ticket for the two o'clock train. He laughed bitterly, for he thought about the tortoise that Melissa called a "puppet," Benson and Melissa continued walking forward, silently watching the various performances. Some time later, they saw a clown running towards them. His face was painted in colorful pastels. He wanted to approach them, but he didn't dare to.Suddenly, he touched the wallet in his jacket and had an idea. He conjured a flower out of thin air. It was a Seville Chrysanthemum. The flower was golden in color and symbolized happiness. The clown brought the flower before Melissa and Benson. All they saw was a wide smile plastered over the pastel face. It's a happy smile, an exaggerated smile, a ridiculous smile. (End of the First Volume) It was the first time Benson and Melissa had seen each other together. They were shocked. They had never met before and were in a state of shock. They didn't know what to say to each other. They looked at each other in a daze. They couldn't believe what they had just seen. It had been a dream. It wasn't a dream at all. But it was a real dream, and it was going to become a reality. It would be the happiest day of Benson's life.

"I am more inclined to call him, the Fallen Creator," he added. "The True Creator has appeared in many forms, such as The Hanged Giant or the Eye behind the Shadow Curtains. The True Creator is not evil, it's just a name for an ancient, ancient entity that has been worshipped by many secret organizations. The true Creator is the core of all that is good in this world."
